1.verse: From Paul and Timothy, servants of Christ Jesus, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, along with the overseers and deacons:

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: I thank my God every time I remember you.

4.verse: Always in every prayer of mine for all of you I pray with joy,

5.verse: because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now.

6.verse: For I am confident of this very thing, that he who began a good work in you will bring it to completion at the day of Christ Jesus.

7.verse: It is right for me to feel this way about all of you, because I have you in my heart, since both in my imprisonment and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, you all share with me in the grace of God.

8.verse: For God is my witness that I long for all of you with the affection of Christ Jesus.

9.verse: And this I pray, that your love may abound more and more, with knowledge and all discernment,

10.verse: so that you may determine what is essential, and so be pure and without blame on the day of Christ,

11.verse: filled with the fruit of righteousness that comes through Jesus Christ, to the glory and praise of God.

12.verse: Now I want you to know, brothers, that what has happened to me has turned out to advance the gospel even more,

13.verse: so that it has become known throughout the entire palace guard, and by everyone else, that my imprisonment is for Christ,

14.verse: and that most of the brothers, having gained confidence in the Lord by my imprisonment, dare more than ever to speak the word of God without fear.

15.verse: To be sure, some are proclaiming Christ out of envy and strife, but others out of goodwill.

16.verse: The latter do it out of love, knowing that I am here for the defense of the gospel.

17.verse: The former proclaim Christ out of a sense of hostility, not sincerely, intending to increase my distress while I am in prison.

18.verse: What then? Only that in every way, whether in pretense or in truth, Christ is proclaimed; and in that I rejoice. Yes, and I will continue to rejoice.

19.verse: For I know that this will turn out for my deliverance through your prayers and the help of the Spirit of Jesus Christ.

20.verse: It is my earnest expectation and hope that I will in no way be put to shame, but that with complete boldness, now as always, Christ will be exalted in my body, whether by life or by death.

21.verse: For to me, to live is Christ and to die is gain.

22.verse: If I am to go on living in the flesh, that means fruitful labor for me; yet I do not know which I would prefer.

23.verse: I am hard pressed between the two, in that I have the desire to depart and be with Christ, for that is much better by far,

24.verse: yet for your sake it is better that I remain in the flesh.

25.verse: So, convinced of this, I know that I will remain, and I will continue with all of you for your progress and joy in the faith,

26.verse: so that when I come again to you, your boasting in Christ Jesus might abound because of me.

27.verse: Only conduct yourselves in a manner worthy of the gospel of Christ, so that, whether I come and see you or remain away, I may hear that you are standing firm in one spirit, striving side by side with one mind for the faith of the gospel,

28.verse: and are in no way frightened by your opponents. This is a sign of destruction for them, but of salvation for you—and that from God.

29.verse: For it has been granted to you on behalf of Christ, not only to believe in him but also to suffer for him,

30.verse: since you are experiencing the same conflict which you saw me in, and now hear that I still face.

1.verse: So if there is any encouragement in Christ, if any comfort from love, if any fellowship in the Spirit, if any affection and compassion,

2.verse: make my joy complete by being like-minded, having the same love, united in spirit, with a single purpose.

3.verse: Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit, but in humility consider others more important than yourselves.

4.verse: Each person should look out not only for his own interests, but also for the interests of others.

5.verse: Your attitude toward one another should be the same as that of Christ Jesus,

6.verse: who, although he was in the form of God, did not regard equality with God a thing to be grasped,

7.verse: but emptied himself, taking on the form of a servant, being born in the likeness of man. And being found in appearance as a man

8.verse: he humbled himself, becoming obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross!

9.verse: Therefore God has highly exalted him and bestowed on him the name that is above every name,

10.verse: so that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, in heaven, and on earth and under the earth,

11.verse: and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ is Lord, to the glory of God the Father.

12.verse: So then, my dear friends, just as you have always obeyed, not only in my presence but even more now in my absence, continue to work out your salvation with fear and trembling,

13.verse: for it is God who is at work in you, both to will and to work on behalf of his good pleasure.

14.verse: Do all things without grumbling or arguing,

15.verse: so that you may be blameless and innocent, children of God above reproach in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you shine like stars in the universe,

16.verse: holding fast the word of life, so that I may have reason to boast on the day of Christ that I did not run in vain or labor in vain.

17.verse: But even if I am to be poured out as a drink offering upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I am glad and rejoice with all of you.

18.verse: Likewise you also should be glad and rejoice with me.

19.verse: I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon, so that I too may be encouraged by news about you.

20.verse: For I have no one else of like mind who will be genuinely concerned for your welfare.

21.verse: For they all look out for their own interests, not for those of Jesus Christ.

22.verse: But you know Timothy’s proven character, how as a child with his father he served with me in the furtherance of the gospel.

23.verse: Therefore I hope to send him just as soon as I see how things will turn out for me;

24.verse: and I trust in the Lord that I myself also will be coming soon.

25.verse: In the meantime I think it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, fellow worker, and fellow soldier, as well as your messenger and minister to my need,

26.verse: because he has been longing for all of you and has been distressed because you heard that he was ill.

27.verse: Indeed he was ill; he almost died. But God had mercy on him, and not only on him but on me as well, so that I would not have sorrow upon sorrow.

28.verse: Therefore I am all the more eager to send him, so that when you see him again you may rejoice and I may no longer be anxious.

29.verse: Therefore welcome him in the Lord with great joy, and hold such men in honor,

30.verse: because he came close to death for the work of Christ, risking his life to make up for the help you were not able to give me.

1.verse: Finally, my brethren, rejoice in the Lord. To write the same things again to you is no trouble for me, and it is a safeguard for you.

2.verse: Beware of the dogs, beware of the evil workers, beware of those who practice mutilation.

3.verse: For we are the true circumcision, who worship by the Spirit of God and glory in Christ Jesus and have no confidence in the flesh—

4.verse: even though I have reason for confidence in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he has reason for confidence in the flesh, I have more:

5.verse: circumcised on the eighth day, a member of the nation of Israel, of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew born of Hebrews. In regard to the law, I was a Pharisee;

6.verse: as for zeal, a persecutor of the church; as for the righteousness set forth in the law, I was blameless.

7.verse: But whatever things were gain to me, these I have come to regard as loss because of Christ.

8.verse: More than that, I regard all things as loss because of the surpassing worth of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things and regard them as rubbish, in order to gain Christ

9.verse: and be found in him, not having a righteousness of my own that comes from the Law, but that which comes through faith in Christ, the righteousness from God that is based on faith—

10.verse: that I may know him and the power of his resurrection and the fellowship of his sufferings, becoming like him in his death,

11.verse: if somehow I may attain the resurrection from the dead.

12.verse: Not that I have already obtained all this or have already reached my goal, but I press on in order to make it my own because Christ Jesus has made me his own.

13.verse: Brothers, I do not consider to have made it my own; but this one thing I do: forgetting what lies behind and reaching out to what lies ahead,

14.verse: I press on toward the goal for the prize of the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.

15.verse: So those of us who are mature should take this point of view; and if in anything you think differently, that too God will make known to you.

16.verse: In any case, let us live up to what we have already attained.

17.verse: Join in following my example, brothers, and pay close attention to those who are living this way, as you have us as an example.

18.verse: For many are living (I have often told you about them but now tell you even with tears) as enemies of the cross of Christ.

19.verse: Their end is destruction, their god is the belly, and they glory in their shame. Their minds are set on earthly things.

20.verse: But our citizenship is in heaven, and it is from there that we eagerly await a Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,

21.verse: who will transform our lowly bodies into the likeness of his glorious body, by the power that also enables him to subject all things to himself.

1.verse: Therefore, my brothers, you whom I love and long for, my joy and crown, stand firm in the Lord in this way, my dear friends!

2.verse: I urge Euodia and I urge Syntyche to agree in the Lord.

3.verse: Yes, I ask you also, my true comrade, help these women who have labored side by side with me in the cause of the gospel, along with Clement and the rest of my fellow workers, whose names are in the book of life.

4.verse: Rejoice in the Lord always; again I say, Rejoice!

5.verse: Let your gentleness be known to every person. The Lord is at hand.

6.verse: Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God.

7.verse: And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable, if there is any excellence, if there is anything worthy of praise, let your mind dwell on these things.

9.verse: What you have learned and received and heard and seen in me—put these things into practice, and the God of peace will be with you.

10.verse: I rejoice in the Lord greatly that now at last you have revived your concern for me. Indeed, you were concerned before, but you had no opportunity.

11.verse: I am not saying this because I am in need, for I have learned to be content in whatever circumstance I find myself.

12.verse: I know what it is to be in want, and I know what it is to have an abundance. In any and every circumstance I have learned the secret, whether I am well-fed or hungry, have plenty or am in need.

13.verse: I can do all things through the one who strengthens me.

14.verse: However, you have acted nobly, sharing with me in my distress.

15.verse: And you Philippians know that in the beginning of my gospel ministry, when I left Macedonia, no church joined with me in giving and receiving but you only,

16.verse: for even in Thessalonica you sent something more than once for my need.

17.verse: Not that I seek the gift; rather, I seek the interest that accrues to your account.

18.verse: I have received all I need and more. I am well supplied, having received from Epaphroditus the gift you sent, a fragrant offering, a sacrifice acceptable and pleasing to God.

19.verse: And my God will supply your every need according to his glorious riches in Christ Jesus.

20.verse: To our God and Father be glory for all time. Amen.

21.verse: Greet every saint in Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me send their greetings to you.

22.verse: All the saints greet you, especially those of Caesar’s household.

23.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
